KnowledgeBase.Title: icompareNE
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: icompare icompareEQ icompareGT icompareGE icompareLT icompareLE

Function.Description: The icompareNE is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Integer values. It returns true if both objects are not equal and false if otherwise.

Brief.Overview: The icompareNE is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Boolean values. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: Use the icompareNE function when you wish to compare two Integers and determine if {int1} is not equal to {int2} and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). These functions only operate on Integer operands. For a more general, but slower, comparison, use the compareEQ, compareNE, compareGT, compareGE, compareLT, and compareLE which performs type checking and type conversions.

Argument.Name: int1
Argument.Note: The first Integer to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the both Integers are not equal and false is both Integers are not equal.
